pr_title: Add checks for maintenance windows during recurring actions

timeline.bodyText:
This must return true. A System which does not have a schedule is allways in maintenance mode. This is the current behavior, you can schedule things at any time.
(The final return false in Line 2205 is correct. When a client has a schedule but no calendar, this client is 'never' in maintenance mode.
timeline.author: mcalmer

timeline.bodyText:
Here we need to be careful with the performance. When this one action has 10000 clients this gets slow.
While having checkIfInMaintenanceMode() for a single client is required, we should also have a function which does a mass checking.
Maybe something like this:
List<Long> systemIdsMaintenanceMode(List<MinionServer> minions)

Could be implemented in MaintenanceManager.java
timeline.author: mcalmer

replies.bodyText: In the end, we check one-by-one, unfortunately (we don't have a method for checking whether a bunch of minions has maintenance windows in their calendars (currently it's implemented one by one)). But I agree that having the method suggested by you (systemIdsMaintenanceMode(mids)) should be there. Then we can optimize it somehow.
replies.author: hustodemon

replies.bodyText:
One more note about the logging: In order to prevent a flood of log messages, I think the following would make sense:

log a warning with the count of skipped minions
log a debug message (in case log level is >= DEBUG) with the minion ids (can explode)

replies.bodyText: What about mapping clients to maintenance schedules first and than just make this test for every maintenance schedule. This would limit the number of test a lot .

replies.bodyText:
We need both lists, the list which could execute the action and the one for the skipped systems as we want to log.
But it can also be achieved by creating the list of minions which can execute the action, and than use this:
minions.stream().filter(m -> !minionsInMaintMode.contains(m)).collect(toList())

for the logging
